member.name: T:Autodesk.Windows.ScaleFactorAction
member.summary: Specifies the action to take when applying a scale factor to a value.

member.name: F:Autodesk.Windows.ScaleFactorAction.Scale
member.summary: Scales the value, which is a multiplication operation.

member.name: F:Autodesk.Windows.ScaleFactorAction.Restore
member.summary: Restores a scaled value back to its original value, which is a division operation.

member.name: T:Autodesk.Windows.ScaleFactorRounding
member.summary: Specifies mathematical rounding performed when applying a scale factor to a value or when converting a scale factor to another type.

member.name: F:Autodesk.Windows.ScaleFactorRounding.None
member.summary: No rounding performed.

member.name: F:Autodesk.Windows.ScaleFactorRounding.Ceiling
member.summary: The result is the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the value.

member.name: F:Autodesk.Windows.ScaleFactorRounding.Floor
member.summary: The result is the largest integer that is less than or equal to the value.

member.name: F:Autodesk.Windows.ScaleFactorRounding.RoundAwayFromZero
member.summary: When the result is halfway between two others, it is rounded toward the nearest value that is away from zero.

member.name: F:Autodesk.Windows.ScaleFactorRounding.RoundToEven
member.summary: When the result is halfway between two others, it is rounded toward the nearest even value.

member.name: F:Autodesk.Windows.ScaleFactorRounding.Truncate
member.summary: The result is the integral part of the value.

member.name: T:Autodesk.Windows.DisplayDeviceInfo
member.summary: Provides information about a display device on current system.

member.name: T:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.ButtonBaseExtensions
member.summary: Provides a set of static methods that extend Windows Forms button control classes derived from .

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.ButtonBaseExtensions.EnableAutoScaleImage(System.Windows.Forms.ButtonBase,System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl)
member.summary: Enables automatic scaling on the image that is displayed on , when its container is scaled.
member.param: The object.
The container object, usually the or that contains .

remarks.para: The image displayed on is specified by the property, and need to be specified before calling this method. This method only supports scaling a image.
For this method to work, the must override and call . See for details.

member.name: T:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.ContainerExtensions
member.summary: Provides a set of static methods that extend Windows Forms containers like and .

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.ContainerExtensions.EnableDefaultAutoScale(System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl,System.Windows.Forms.AutoScaleMode)
member.summary: Enables automatic scaling supported by Windows Forms.
member.param: The container object, such as a or a .
One of the values that specifies the automatic scaling mode of .

remarks.para: This method must be called inside the InitializeComponent method of and before calling ResumeLayout. As InitializeComponent is a method generated by Windows Forms designer, any changes made in the designer will flush away this call. Be sure to add it back after editing in the designer.
For a derived from , is typically set to unless the user control is to be hosted by a window that is not implemented in Windows Forms.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.ContainerExtensions.GetAbsoluteScaleFactor(System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl)
member.summary: Gets the current scale factor of the .
member.param: The container object, such as a or a .
member.returns: The current scale factor of the . If the container has been scaled multiple times, the returned value is the accumulated scale factor.
member.remarks: For this method to work, the must override and call . See for details.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.ContainerExtensions.AutoScaleCompletedRegister(System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl,System.EventHandler)
member.summary: Registers the specified event handler which is called when the specified container has completed automatic scaling.
member.param: The container object that raises the event, such as a or a .
The delegate that handles the event.

remarks.para: If some controls have called automatic scaling extension methods to associate themselves with this container, the container will also wait for automatic scaling applied on these controls before raising the event.
For this method to work, the must override and call . See for details.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.ContainerExtensions.AutoScaleCompletedUnregister(System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl,System.EventHandler)
member.summary: Unregisters the specified event handler which was previously registered using .
member.param: The container object that raises the event, such as a or a .
The delegate that handles the event.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.ContainerExtensions.OnScaleControl(System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Notifies the framework that the specified container is being scaled.
member.param: The container object, such as a or a .
The factor by which the container is being scaled.

remarks.para: This method is mandatory for most of the other scaling related extension methods to work.
The container class, usually derived from or , needs to override the method and call this method.

member.name: T:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.FormExtensions
member.summary: Provides a set of static methods that extend .

true to call the method. See for details.

remarks.para: This method must be called inside the InitializeComponent method of and before calling ResumeLayout. member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.FormExtensions.WorkaroundInitialSize(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Notifies the framework to apply a workaround for the initial size issue of a form in high DPI display.
member.param: The container object.

remarks.para: It's unnecessary to explicitly call this method in most cases, because calling with default values will lead to this method. If called explicitly, it must be called inside the InitializeComponent method of and before calling ResumeLayout.
For this method to work, the must override and call . See for details.

member.param: The object.
The container object, usually the or that contains .

The container object, usually the or that contains .

remarks.para: This method scales the value of and properties of the existing columns in . A column in content-based automatic sizing mode or fill mode is skipped during scaling the Width property.
For this method to work, the must override and call . See for details.

The container object, usually the or that contains .

remarks.para: This method scales the value of and properties of . A column in content-based automatic sizing mode or fill mode is skipped during scaling the Width property.

member.name: T:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.AdaptiveImage
member.summary: Provides static methods that load bitmap images adaptively depending on dpi settings.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.AdaptiveImage.Bitmap(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a new from the provided buffer.
member.param: The data buffer used to load the image.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.AdaptiveImage.Bitmap(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new from the provided stream.
member.param: The data stream used to load the image.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.AdaptiveImage.Bitmap(System.Resources.ResourceManager,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new from the provided and resource name.
member.param: The that contains the image data.
The name of the resource that contains the image data.

remarks.para: This method retrieves image data from a . The following types of objects are supported: , , array of .
An adaptive bitmap need to be stored as an array of in resource. Other types lead to data loss.

The Managed Resource Editor automatically sets the type to when an adaptive bitmap is added. This could be avoided in one of the following ways:
Before adding, change the extension name of the adaptive bitmap file to an unknown one to the editor, for example ".bin".
After adding, edit the resx file in xml mode, and change the type to Byte[]. For example:
<data name="MyBitmap" type="System.Resources.ResXFileRef, System.Windows.Forms"> <value>MyBitmap.tif;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089</value> </data>

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.AdaptiveImage.Bitmap(System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates a new from the provided URI.
member.param: The URI used to load the image.

member.summary: Creates a new from the provided buffer.
member.param: The data buffer used to load the image.

member.summary: Creates a new from the provided stream.
member.param: The data stream used to load the image.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.AdaptiveImage.Icon(System.Resources.ResourceManager,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new from the provided and resource name.
member.param: The that contains the image data.
The name of the resource that contains the image data.

remarks.para: This method retrieves image data from a . The following types of objects are supported: , , array of .
An adaptive bitmap need to be stored as an array of in resource. Other types lead to data loss.

The Managed Resource Editor automatically sets the type to when an adaptive bitmap is added. This could be avoided in one of the following ways:
Before adding, change the extension name of the adaptive bitmap file to an unknown one to the editor, for example ".bin".
After adding, edit the resx file in xml mode, and change the type to Byte[]. For example:
<data name="MyBitmap" type="System.Resources.ResXFileRef, System.Windows.Forms"> <value>MyBitmap.tif;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089</value> </data>

member.name: T:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.SplitContainerExtensions

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.SplitContainerExtensions.EnableAutoScaleMinSize(System.Windows.Forms.SplitContainer,System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl)
member.summary: Enables automatic scaling on the minimal sizes of panels in , when its container is scaled.
member.param: The object.
The container object, usually the or that contains .

remarks.para: This method scales the value of and properties of .
For this method to work, the must override and call . See for details.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Forms.SplitContainerExtensions.UseSystemSizeCursor(System.Windows.Forms.SplitContainer)
member.summary: Uses the default two-headed horizontal/vertical sizing cursor from OS to replace the Windows Forms specific cursor applied on .
member.param: The object.
member.remarks: The cursor to be used is determined by the and properties of . This method doesn't track changes of these properties, so call this again if these properties are changed.

member.name: T:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap
member.summary: Provides a specialized that loads bitmap images adaptively depending on dpi settings in interoperability scenarios.

member.name: E:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.DecodeFailed
member.summary: Occurs when the image fails to load, due to a corrupt image header.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.DpiX
member.summary: Gets the horizontal dpi of the bitmap.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.DpiY
member.summary: Gets the vertical dpi of the bitmap.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.Format
member.summary: Gets the pixel format of the bitmap data.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.Palette
member.summary: Gets the color palette of the bitmap, if one is specified.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.PixelHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the bitmap in pixels.

member.name: P:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.PixelWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the bitmap in pixels.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.CopyPixels(System.Array,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the bitmap pixel data into an array of pixels with the specified stride, starting at the specified offset.
member.param: The destination array.
The stride of the bitmap.
The pixel location where copying begins.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.CopyPixels(System.Windows.Int32Rect,System.Array,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the bitmap pixel data within the specified rectangle into an array of pixels that has the specified stride starting at the specified offset.
member.param: The source rectangle to copy. An value specifies the entire bitmap.
The destination array.
The stride of the bitmap.
The pixel location where copying begins.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.CopyPixels(System.Windows.Int32Rect,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the bitmap pixel data within the specified rectangle.
member.param: The source rectangle to copy. An value specifies the entire bitmap.
A pointer to the buffer.
The size of the buffer.
The stride of the bitmap.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.FromBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Creates a new from the provided .
member.param: The that contains the bitmap data.
member.remarks: The returned is adaptively created from the , using all frames and dpi info embedded within them. Only frames in the dimension are scanned; other dimensions are ignored.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.FromHBitmap(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new managed from the provided pointer to an unmanaged bitmap.
member.param: A pointer to the unmanaged bitmap.
true to destroy the unmanaged before returning from this method; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The dpi of the unmanaged is treated as system dpi. Any dpi info embedded is ignored. Alpha channel is supported if the unmanaged is a 32-bpp device independent bitmap. Premultiplied alpha is unsupported.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.FromHBitmap(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean,System.Windows.Media.Color)
member.summary: Creates a new managed from the provided pointer to an unmanaged bitmap.
member.param: A pointer to the unmanaged bitmap.
true to destroy the unmanaged before returning from this method; otherwise, false.
A color that is made transparent in the created .
member.remarks: The dpi of the unmanaged is treated as system dpi. Any dpi info embedded is ignored. Alpha channel is supported if the unmanaged is a 32-bpp device independent bitmap. Premultiplied alpha is unsupported.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.FromIcon(System.Drawing.Icon)
member.summary: Creates a new from the provided .
member.param: The that contains the bitmap data.
member.remarks: The dpi of the is treated as standard dpi.

member.name: M:Autodesk.Windows.Interop.InteropAdaptiveBitmap.FromResourceManager(System.Resources.ResourceManager,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new from the provided and resource name.
member.param: The that contains the bitmap data.
The name of the resource that contains the bitmap data.

remarks.para: This method retrieves bitmap data from a . The following types of objects are supported: , , array of .
An adaptive bitmap need to be stored as an array of in resource. Other types lead to data loss.

The Managed Resource Editor automatically sets the type to when an adaptive bitmap is added. This could be avoided in one of the following ways:
Before adding, change the extension name of the adaptive bitmap file to an unknown one to the editor, for example ".bin".
After adding, edit the resx file in xml mode, and change the type to Byte[]. For example:
<data name="MyBitmap" type="System.Resources.ResXFileRef, System.Windows.Forms"> <value>MyBitmap.tif;System.Byte[], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089</value> </data>
